item.title: Learn implicits: Scala reflection
item.description: Implicits are arguably the most unique and misunderstood language feature of Scala. Unlike other advanced features in the language, they are very hard to avoid: most major libraries in Scala, starting from Scala collections, make heavy use of implicits. That use is not invisible to the users of the library, especially when we choose to look at the code. The other tricky part about implicits is that there are so many ways to use them, each with a different reason and pattern. They can't be fully explained in one coherent post.

item.title: Stoop: our first open source release
item.description: We are happy to annouce the release of our first open source software, Stoop. Based on an existing Haskell library, Stoop is a Scala DSL for interfacing with CouchDB. Implementation can be easily switched between talking to an actual Couch or a fake (mock) one for testing. We've released this under the Modified BSD License, so check it out and let us know if you have any questions, if you find bugs, or even if you have a pull request to fix something!
